abstract.text: Get started writing a chat bot using the library.

inlineContent.text: This page is a short introduction to creating your first bot using the library.
The first thing that you’ll need is a Discord JWT. These can be obtained by going to
and selecting/making one. Then on the app page click “click to reveal”.
Once you have your token you can start writing some code.
All of these steps assume you are working inside of a class that conforms to
Configuring the client is straightforward. The intializer for the client takes the JWT we got in the previous step, and an optinal array of configuration options.

code: self.client = DiscordClient(token: "Bot myjwt.from.discord", delegate: self, configuration: [.log(.info)])

inlineContent.text: It’s important to note that we’ve added “Bot” in front of the token. This is tell Discord that this token represents a bot token. This is required unless the token is a user token. If the token is an OAuth token then the token should be prefaced with “Bearer”. The configuration used in this example turns on the most basic logging. More about the different configurations available can be found on the
Once we have the client initialized, it’s time to add any delegate methods that we want to listen for.

code: func client(_ client: DiscordClient, didConnect connected: Bool) {
func client(_ client: DiscordClient, didCreateMessage message: DiscordMessage) {
client.sendMessage("I got your command", to: message.channelId)

inlineContent.text: In this code we’ve added two delegate methods. The

inlineContent.code: client(_ client: DiscordClient, didConnect connected: Bool)

inlineContent.text: method is called once all shards have connected. It’s best to wait until this event is received before trying to do anything with the client, otherwise the client might not be fully populated with Guild and Channel information.

inlineContent.code: client(_ client: DiscordClient, didCreateMessage message: DiscordMessage)

inlineContent.text: method is called whenever a message is received from the gateway. This particular implemenation just checks if the content of the message is a command, and if it is, sends a response.
